history.content: Hi I am the course manager for 47B and it's generally about 3 units worth of work (even though it's a 1 unit course...), and 61B is a full 4 unit course.  I would let any students chime in too, but the main thing with 47B is to stay on top of the course material all semester, rather than let time go and get overwhelmed at the end.
I took a 61B equivalent at CC before coming to Cal; I ended up taking 61B anyway. I thought it was definitely worthwhile to take, as I still learned a ton.

I'm a CC transfer and I've taken a class that articulates with 61B, so I could skip it if I want.

However, I'm still considering retaking it, because I've heard it's a worthwhile experience and it's critical for interviews and upper division classes, especially with Hug teaching next semester. After thinking about it though, it seems like it might be more beneficial to take 61C next semester and do an internship over summer (currently, I have 61C scheduled for the summer). If I were to take 61C next semester, I would either self-study 61B or take 47B in addition to self studying.

I was wondering if anyone who has taken 47B, or knows people who have taken it, could share what their experience was like. What was the general workload of the class and were the midterms / final exam comparable to those of 61B or are they easier? Would skipping 47B and 61B entirely, and instead self-studying the material be sufficient to do well in interviews / upper division classes?

Any insight would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
history.subject: CS 47b Workload / General Information
